alert.note: Alert for Watauga (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 26 at 1:41PM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Flood Warning Remains in Effect for the Watauga River and its Tributaries Until 6 PM EST this Evening... ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following county, Watauga. * WHEN...Until 600 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding is being observed along the Watauga River at Rominger as well as upstream at Valle Crucis and Sugar Grove. Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying as well as flood-prone locations is imminent or is already occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 135 PM EST, During the past 24 hours, rainfall of 2 to 3 inches, with local rainfall amounts in excess of 4 inches, has been common throughout the Watauga River basin. This has resulted in flooding along the Watauga River near Sugar Grove, as well as its tributaries. At 130 PM EST, the Watauga River was at 7.0 ft. Flood stage is 6.0 ft. The river has crested and has begun to fall. However, additional rainfall is expected across the region and a Flood Watch remains in effect until 10 AM EST Wednesday morning. Exactly when the river will drop below flood stage depends on the amount of additional rainfall expected during the next 12-18 hours. At a minimum, the river is expected to remain in minor flood until this evening. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rominger, Sugar Grove, Valle Crucis, as well as areas along U.S. Highway 321 near Sugar Grove. - For additional information please go to http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Precautionary/Preparedness Action: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
